Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2018063267.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2001, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Silvia Stewart was seen for the last time at the Caribana Parade in Toronto, Ontario. Silvia had been visiting Toronto with her daughter from South Carolina, USA, and she suffers from Alzheimer’s.

Case reference: 2014003568.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1998, Todd Russell Fraser was seen for the last time in the Fairview district in Vancouver, British Columbia. All his belongings were found in his apartment. Todd has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006021799.CaseDesc: Leo Payash, aged 8, was last seen on July 01, 1957. He and his mother Cecilia Payash, aged 48 years, were walking on Red Lake Road and neither has been seen since.

Deformity: Nose, Described as having a "hooked" nose

Case reference: 2014004796.CaseDesc: Shirley Lee Cletheroe was last seen on June 9, 2006 in the Fort St. John area. She has had no contact with her friends or family since that date.

Case reference: 2013000068.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1994, Yvon Ringuet was reported missing from his home in the Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie district in Montreal, Quebec. Yvon would call or visit his mother everyday. All his personal belongings were found in his home and no one has seen or heard from him since.

Tattoo: Cross, right or left upper arm

Case reference: 2014006229.CaseDesc: In 1981, Cyril Thistle was seen for the last time when he was out on day parole and visiting his sister.  There is reason to believe that Mr. Thistle lived a transient lifestyle as he was known in Toronto, Ontario and on the west coast of Canada.

Case reference: 2018056500.CaseDesc: On August 2 1997, Ronald Halpern was last seen leaving his residence to go to the Toronto International Airport. Ronald boarded a flight traveling to the Dominican Republic.

Case reference: 2014003811.CaseDesc: On December 28, 1988, Murray Copp was seen for the last time at the Salvation Army Community and Family Services Centre in Moncton, New Brunswick.

Scar: Nose, Between eyes and above nose

Case reference: 2012020075.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1974, Annie Yassie was seen for the last time by a taxi driver in Churchill, Manitoba. At that time, Annie was accompanied by a male friend.

Case reference: 2013000091.CaseDesc: An unidentified male was found in False Creek near the Maritime Museum on May 7th 1998. The deceased had a pack of matches from the Bridges restaurant in his pocket

Teeth: Visible Missing, Two front upper teeth on the left side
Foreign Object: Matches found in pocket from Bridges Restaurant

Case reference: 2022050376.CaseDesc: On September 29, 2022, a tugboat crew discovered the body of a 30- to 40-year-old woman floating in the water at Spanish Banks in Vancouver, British Columbia. The woman is described as black and weighing between 174-201 pounds. She wore a backpack and had brown eyes and short black curly hair pulled back into a bun. A blue inflatable kayak and an orange life vest were discovered nearby.

Case reference: 2013000139.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Clayton Condos. He was last seen on March 20, 2006, in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004933.CaseDesc: On May 3, 1987, at approximately 7:00pm, Jimmy Hong was last seen by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. His friend indicated that Jimmy had left for Hamilton, Ontario, and would be returning the following Monday.

Case reference: 2006018399.CaseDesc: David Sawyer and his girlfriend were last seen on May 17, 1977. They went fishing for the day on Pickerel Lake. Their capsized canoe was recovered but Mr. Sawyer has not been located. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2016012267.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2016, Lorlene Bone was last seen at a friend’s residence on the Shoal River Indian Reserve in Manitoba. Lorlene is a mother of four and it is out of character for her not to contact her family.

Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, Three hearts

Case reference: 2014005112.CaseDesc: Tian You Li left his extended family home in East Vancouver to go for his routine walk. He never returned. He suffers from Alzheimers and may be confused and disorientated.

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2014001816.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1981, Wayne Martin was seen for the last time while he was out for a walk at the Rideau Heights Campground in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2006011799.CaseDesc: Thomas Lyon was last seen in the area of Iron Bridge, Pelican Lake, Sioux Lookout on June 28, 1998 by two acquaintances.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003167.CaseDesc: Rufus Standingribbon was last seen in the month of October 1999 near Spirit River, Alberta. Mrs. Standingribbon did not notify anyone that he was going to be leaving the area as he normally did.

Case reference: 2016069646.CaseDesc: James Kunuk was reported missing by his landlord in December, 2016.  He was last seen by his family on September 21st, 2016 in Whitehorse, Yukon.  Mr. Kunuk has previously lived in downtown Vancouver, and also has family connections to the Northwest Territories.  He did not contact his family for his birthday, or over the Christmas holidays, which is unusual for him.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Cross with "Life" written on it

Case reference: 2015026912.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2015, Kandice Singbeil was seen for the last time by her boyfriend in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014005179.CaseDesc: On September 20, 2006, Richard Griffis was seen for the last time when he went down to the White River in the remote community of Beaver Creek in the Yukon. Richard had been visiting from the United States, and had travelled to the Yukon to test out an outdoor survival suit that he invented.

Case reference: 2009002599.CaseDesc: Mark Mayhew was residing with family at a residence in Sturgeon Falls. He left overnight without notice. There was no incident which upset him and caused him to leave. Mark was on foot, he had no vehicle and no known destination.

Teeth: False, No teeth; had false teeth but was not wearing them at the time.

Case reference: 2012020046.CaseDesc: On January, 17, 2008, Bradley Worobeck left his place of employment in downtown Calgary and went to a pub that was also in downtown Calgary. That was the last time anyone saw or heard from Bradley.

Case reference: 2014006235.CaseDesc: A lake freighter capsized in a violent storm on Lake Winnipeg, just north of Hecla Island, Manitoba. The vessel carried nine crew members and one passenger. There was only one survivor who managed to float on a piece of the wreckage to safety. All of the bodies of the remaining occupants were recovered with the exception of Allan Clemens and Tache Everett who were never located. Autopsies confirmed that the causes of death for those recovered were either drowning or death due to exposure in the cold water. Mr. Clemens and Mr. Everett are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2016012810.CaseDesc: On March 12th, 2016 shortly after midnight, Denny Poole and a friend left Dawson Creek with the intent of heading to Fort St John. It is unknown if they intended to walk, hitchhike, or had other means to get there. The duo became disoriented and ended up wandering the highway and back roads for over 20 hours. It was learned that neither of them was prepared to be out for this period of time. At some point, Denny and his friend had a difference of opinion on whether they should continue on their journey or not, and the two ended up separating. The last confirmed sighting of Denny was just south of the Kiskatinaw Bridge on Highway 97. Denny has some disabilities and it is recommended that he be under adult supervision.

Shoes: Black, Purple, green and white "Osiris" brand
Sweater: Grey, Dark grey hoodie with red "DGK" symbol

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2019024246.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2019, Daniel Richards was seen for the last time in the area of Niagara Falls, Ontario. Niagara Police responded to a report of a man that had jumped into the falls. The police were able to obtain a description and a photograph of the man who was identified as Daniel. His vehicle was located abandoned in the nearby area.

Case reference: 2016013490.CaseDesc: On March 15, 2016, Ravishankar Vallepuram was seen for the last time at his residence in Scarborough, Ontario. Ravishankar has never gone missing in the past, nor has he spent the night away from his residence.

Case reference: 2020007826.CaseDesc: Gerhart Kiel was reported missing from his residence in Minburn, Alberta. His vehicle, a dark grey 2009 Ford Ranger which has a truck bed cover in the same colour, was also reported missing from his residence. Gerhart has not had any contact with his family since November 23, 2019.

Case reference: 2006014899.CaseDesc: Robert Commu was last seen at his residence in South Dumfries Township, Ontario on March 31, 1996. At 7:00 p.m. on this date, a neighbour went to the residence and found the front door open and his compact disc player repeatedly playing the same song. Mr. Commu had been despondent over a failed relationship and an illness in the family. Mr. Commu has not contacted any family members or friends since his disappearance.

Jacket: Leather, Black, White, Red Maple leaf on the back
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , lion with wings

Case reference: 2014016772.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2014 around 1PM, Yvon Guevin left his residence in Pierreville, Quebec with his vehicle, a burgundy and gray Jeep Cherokee registered in Quebec. He left with his little black dog, a "miniature Pinscher" named Costaud. His family and friends have not seen or heard from him since, which is out of the ordinary.

Case reference: 2014002504.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1982, friends reported Michael Roshko missing to police. At the time Michael had not been seen in over a week and friends had become concerned. Police located Michael's camp and found his personal belongings still there. Mr. Roshko has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2014003894.CaseDesc: Jean Gravel and Jean-Guy Champagne were employees of the Rio Bar in downtown Trois-Rivières. On July 6, 1972, they arrived at work in the early evening; they were to work there until closing. They never returned home and have not been seen since. They were reported missing on July 10, 1972.

Jewelry: Gold, ring on the left ring finger
Silver, wedding ring on the left ring finger

Case reference: 2008003399.CaseDesc: William Smith was last seen operating a large boat leaving Port Rowan, Ontario at approximately 5:30 pm on June 23, 1983. The boat was seen heading out to the north channel, which would lead into Lake Erie. The boat is described as a white, 31 foot, 1977 Bertram hardtop cruiser with a flying bridge. The hull VIN number is 3121641B and the boat had twin Mercruiser 330 hp engines.

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2013000016.CaseDesc: Marjorie Ferris was reported missing when she did not show up in London, Ontario, where she was to visit friends. Her apartment was found secured and intact with her purse inside. Her vehicle was parked in the underground garage at her building. Extensive investigation failed to uncover any information regarding her disappearance.

Teeth: False, Full upper and lower dentures

Case reference: 2012020019.CaseDesc: Emerson Dobroskay, was last seen on October 28, 1988 at the Pit Pub located at the University of British Columbia. It is believed that Emerson may have fallen into a large pit dug for construction, but all searches have failed to locate him. Although foul play is not suspected, it cannot be ruled out.

Case reference: 2012020120.CaseDesc: On October 19th 2003, Jeanne-D'Arc Asselin, 66, was to go to her boyfriend's but called to cancel at the last minute. Ms Asselin went to buy beer at the convenience store and was never seen again. She disappeared from Valleyfield. During the months prior to her disappearance, she seemed confused and had memory loss. Ms Asselin had suffered a stroke in the past.

Case reference: 2018000902.CaseDesc: Daniel Harvey was seen for the last time on December 28, 2017 in the Bellerive district of Montreal, Quebec. None of Daniel's personal items were missing from his apartment.

Case reference: 2006010799.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1979, Keith Cromwell was last seen as he departed from Quarry Island/Lake of the Woods, near Kenora, Ontario, in a motor boat. Keith never arrived at his destination, Fog Island.

Case reference: 2017074201.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1995, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in Lake Ontario, near Cherry Beach, in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he may be of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2014006195.CaseDesc: On April 12, 2004, Randy Boudreau was last seen at his residence in Campbellton, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2021017400.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2021, at approximately 12:15 a.m., Saniyya Dennis was seen for the last time on the pedestrian bridge leading to Goat Island in Niagara Falls, New York. Saniyya sent a last text message at 1:23 a.m., from the Goat Island and Luna Island area.

Shoes: Black, White, Black and white check "VANS" shoes
Sweater: Black, HOODIE, White lettering on the left side of chest and across the back
Hat: Black, KNIT, White lettering on the brim

Case reference: 2014003846.CaseDesc: On March 1st, 1992, Blaine Prince and his friend were on a ski-doo on the river with two other friends. As they were driving on the river the lead ski-doo encountered ice that gave away however they accelerated to stronger ice. Mr. Prince and his friend were not as lucky and broke through the ice. Both men were observed hanging onto the edge of the ice however Mr. Prince soon let go and did not re-surface.

Case reference: 2019017116.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2003, Anne-Marie Laforest was last seen by her family in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006137.CaseDesc: On January 2, 2012, Spencer Joly was last seen in Vernon BC. Spencer told a number of people he was travelling to the Kelowna Airport and eventually flying to Phuket Thailand. Spencer was seen later that same day being dropped off by Taxi in Predator Ridge, a new housing development in Vernon. There was no record of Spencer ever leaving the country or arriving in Thailand.

Case reference: 2014001428.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1998, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Rémi Engrand left a residence for men in Valleyfield, Quebec, for a walk with two other residents of the center where he had been staying for a few days. They went to the Delpha-Sauvé Park, where Rémi wanted to go swimming in the river, near the waterfall. The three separated, leaving Rémi alone and when they returned, they found Rémi’s clothes on the shoreline. The current in this section of the river is very fast and the presence of the falls makes swimming very risky. Rémi has not been seen since this time.

Case reference: 2011000499.CaseDesc: In August 1996, Bruce Berthelot left his family residence in Leamington, Ontario. M. Berthelot indicated that he was going away for a little while and asked his mother for $1000. He had been unemployed for several months and was dealing with some health issues. Prior to leaving he telephoned his friends in Manitoba a number of times. His family believes that he was headed to Western Canada. He has lived in Manitoba in the past. Mr. Berthelot is a skilled carpenter, and enjoys fishing and boating.  He has had no contact with any members of his family or friends since leaving.

Case reference: 2013000138.CaseDesc: Peter Limberis was last seen in Trail BC on July 20, 2005. He left Trail on his way to Saskatchewan, driving in his white 2003 Saturn Vue with Saskatchewan licence plate 850ENA. Mr. Limberis was also travelling with his dog, a white and brown smooth haired Fox Terrier named Pedro.

Chain: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, chain
Shirt: Cloth, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Jersey
Watch: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Watch
Pants: Cloth, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Track
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Jail house noose

Case reference: 2016066673.CaseDesc: On May 29, 1982, a disarticulated left foot was found washed up on the shore of Lake Simcoe, in front of the Shore Room Tavern (at the end of the 10th Concession of Innisfil Township). It has been estimated to have been in the water 1-5 years.

Shoes: Brown, Two-tone brown lace-up, size 9D shoe

Case reference: 2012020101.CaseDesc: William Gill was last seen in the early morning hours of December 21, 1981, leaving an apartment on Appleby Drive in Saskatoon, SK. Mr. Gill had been out earlier that evening at a local nightclub with his co-worker.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2016065648.CaseDesc: On April 6, 1968, skeletal remains were located at the base of a 50 foot cliff on the bank of the lower Niagara River, Niagara Falls. A pair of boots was located with the remains.

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Case reference: 2020050890.CaseDesc: On August 9, 2020, days after the death of her son, Audrey Beaver was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. That day, Audrey had told her family that she planned on setting up a tent to live in.

Case reference: 2013000038.CaseDesc: Samuel Lachance was last seen at the Beverage Room in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan near the end of July, 1987. Samuel was in very good physical condition at the time of his disappearance and worked in different logging camps in Saskatchewan. Family members say that it was unusual for Samuel not to have any contact with them or his friends near the time he was last seen.

Case reference: 2008245047.CaseDesc: Jadon may be in the company of his non-custodial mother Roxana Eliana YANEZ PARADA.

Case reference: 2019035278.CaseDesc: On August 21, 1982, the remains of a male were found on the banks of Bouchard Island, near Saint-Sulpice, Quebec.

Coat: Leather, Black, Three-quarters with fur collar

Case reference: 2014005651.CaseDesc: On May 10th 1969, Lorie Lewis, 7, was reported missing from the city of Squamish. She was last seen on the same day by her siblings of similar age, playing near a beach on the Cheekeye River, upstream of its confluence with the Cheakamus River. At the time, the water run off was swift, and Lorie is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014006333.CaseDesc: Deanne MacNeil was last seen on video surveillance at the Mundare Liquor Store during the early morning hours of November 28, 2013.

Case reference: 2014004704.CaseDesc: On the morning of March 24, 2000, René Rosa was seen for the last time at his residence in La Minerve, Quebec. On this day, at approximately 2:40 p.m., René’s vehicle, a 1996 purple Chevrolet Cavalier, was found abandoned near Montée Charette in La Minerve. René has not been seen and we have not heard from him since.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Engraved bracelet
Tattoo: Upper Back, Naked woman and atomic mushroom cloud

Case reference: 2020054047.CaseDesc: On December 21, 2020, MacKenzie Trottier was seen for the last time in the 300 block of Trent Crescent in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.  At the time of her disappearance, MacKenzie may have been in a vulnerable state.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Shaved on right side

Case reference: 2014001590.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1990, Claude L'Heureux was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Claude had worked in bars in The Village district of Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2015020897.CaseDesc: In April of 2015, Delmer Paul Bonnetrouge was seen for the last time in Fort Providence, Northwest Territories. He was reported missing by his family.

Case reference: 2021015408.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2021, Ziyue "Moses" LIU was reported missing from his family home in Surrey, British Columbia. On April 19, 2021, Moses was last seen in Coquitlam, British Columbia. He may or may not be wearing glasses.

Shoes: Black, White, Running shoes with white soles, slip on

Case reference: 2012020057.CaseDesc: Peter Halcrow was last seen on March 14, 1994 walking in the "Sawmill" area between 14:00 and 15:00.  Mr. Halcrow has not been seen since.

Shoes: Leather, Green, White, Reebok with purple

Case reference: 2014001192.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1983, the partial remains of a young adult male were found on the south side of Cracroft Island. He was partially clothed in a wetsuit, and may have been out fishing when he went missing. The last joint of the little finger on his left hand was amputated. He is estimated to have gone missing sometime in 1982 or 1983.

Pants: Cloth, Gold, Small sweatpants with drawstring waist
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Little Finger, Amputation of left pinky finger

Case reference: 2013000136.CaseDesc: Mr. Joseph Moore was last seen on October 31, 2012 by his employer in Kincardine, Ontario.  He was reported missing on November 12, 2012. Upon investigation, M. Moore's apartment was found neat and tidy and his clothing and luggage had been left behind. Joseph Moore is known to suffer from severe cases of depression. The last potential sighting was at the Kincardine Davidson Centre on November 8, 2012.  A media blitz was done to request feedback for missing person Joseph Moore with limited feedback. An extensive search of the area was conducted with negative results.

Case reference: 2016068415.CaseDesc:
On July 17, 1975 a "Hush Puppy" style loafer shoe, size 10, containing a skeletonized left foot was found on the south shore of the Ottawa River in Chute a Blondeau, Ontario. The colour of the shoe is not discernible. 
Examination of the foot bones by a Forensic Pathologist revealed that this individual may be a male, aged 20-50 years, 5'10" to 6'1" in height, 200-230 lbs., with no abnormalities of the foot bones and no arthritis. The Forensic Pathologist had estimated that death occurred in excess of one year to possibly 5 years.

Case reference: 2006022299.CaseDesc: Nick Kostiuk was last seen in a boat leaving a dock on Lower Manitou Lake. He could not swim and his wife saw him leaving without a life jacket. Mr. Kostiuk has been presumed drowned.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Accutron watch
Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wire frame

Case reference: 2014004675.CaseDesc: Jean-Louis Bourgeault was last seen on September 12, 2005 in Montreal. Mr. Bourgeault left the Suzanne Blanchard Pavillon, a mental health resource linked to the Louis Hippolyte Lafontaine Hospital. Mr. Bourgeault was homeless in downtown Montreal prior to entering the Pavillon.

Case reference: 2014005549.CaseDesc: At the end of September, 2010, Dustin McMillan left Edmonton to drive to Ontario. Police have not been able to confirm where and when Dustin was last seen but he never made it to his final destination.

Case reference: 2006002399.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1995, an unidentified woman was discovered under a cement floor at the former site of Robertson Motors located on 1515 Danforth Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. The cement floor was poured in 1949.

Case reference: 2018005122.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2018, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Balwant Singh was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Balwant was visiting Canada and failed to board his returning flight on January 29 at 6:00 p.m.

Case reference: 2020038049.CaseDesc: On March 27, 2020, Joshua Reiner was reported missing to New York Police, in the United States. Joshua’s vehicle was located in Niagara Falls, New York. A male was later observed on surveillance cameras climbing over a railing and walking towards the brink of the falls. The male was later confirmed to be Joshua Reiner by family members. It is suspected that he jumped into the falls and did not resurface.

Case reference: 2008020999.CaseDesc: Dave MacDermott was last seen on or about Saturday November 9, 2002 in Kitchener, Ontario. He had been out celebrating a friend’s birthday. It was initially reported that Dave left town with his dog and his 1990 Ford Mustang. However, his vehicle was located parked in a parking lot near his residence and his dog was found wandering the neighbourhood.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Some missing teeth with some decay; he has cracked lower left teeth
Boots: Black, Motorcycle boots with a buckle on each boot
Tattoo: Torso (Back), small ladybug between shoulder blades

Case reference: 2014003430.CaseDesc: Alim Hasan was last seen by his mother in Burnaby on March 21, 1990, when he was returning to his residence in Edmonton via Grey Hound Bus. Alim had a history of mental illness. On April 6, 1990, an unknown person left one of Alim’s luggage at the front door of Hope RCMP Detachment.

Luggage: Synthetic, Red, White, Sports Bag, Red Sports bag with white trim

Case reference: 2006024099.CaseDesc: David Jennings was last seen on June 13, 1991. He is presumed to have drowned on Blackstone Lake in Archipelago Township.

Jacket: Silk, Blue, across shoulders "Bass Fishing"  picture bass fish

Case reference: 2012020183.CaseDesc: The skeletal remains of an adolescent were located in Terrace.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Some dental work and some teeth missing

Case reference: 2006017199.CaseDesc: Mistie Murray was last seen on May 31, 1995, in the Goderich area.

Teeth: Space between her two upper front teeth

Case reference: 2014002595.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1997, John Grabluk was seen for the last time at the Scarborough Postal Union Office in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, John had taken a leave of absence.

Case reference: 2014002002.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1977, Gaetan Pichette was seen for the last time in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. His family and friends have not seen or heard from him since.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Arm tattoo, inscribed with "COCU"

Case reference: 2010006399.CaseDesc: Glen Wesley, a patient at the Northeast Mental Health Hospital, was granted permission to leave the facility on his birthday. Staff believe he went to downtown North Bay. Mr. Wesley did not return and was noticed missing at approximately 2:15 PM. He suffers from Schizophrenia which requires medication. Since his disappearance there have been several unconfirmed sightings of Mr. Wesley in the Cochrane, Timmins and New Liskeard areas.

Case reference: 2014006627.CaseDesc: On November 9, 2012, Andria Meise was reported missing from Kelowna, British Columbia. Andria was last seen in Grande Prairie, Alberta between July 2010 and September 2010. Andria was known to be living a high risk lifestyle and traveled between Grande Prairie, Dawson Creek, Fort St. John, Kelowna and Vancouver.

Case reference: 2019015016.CaseDesc: On March 14, 2019, at approximately 5:30 am, Monica Duah was seen for the last time by her friends at her work place in Toronto, Ontario. She failed to show up to work for her scheduled shifts.

Case reference: 2014001441.CaseDesc: On April 28, 1972, James Cordell was seen for the last time leaving his parents’ residence in St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, James was driving a 1970 silver blue Dodge Polar vehicle.  He had a cast on his right arm and his teeth were wired shut as a result of a motor vehicle collision.

Shirt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, White, SHRT SLEEV, Mauve and white terrycloth short sleeve

Case reference: 2015017939.CaseDesc: On November 10, 1998, the body of a man was discovered in a container shipped by the "Cast" Company, which was being stored in the Port of Montreal. The individual had taken refuge, with food, in the shipping container which had arrived in Montreal by boat (the "Canmar Valour") from Livorno, Italy.

Shoes: Brown, "Vera Gomma Italie" brand shoes, with laces. Inscribed "TAOS"
Belt: Dark patterned belt with a silver coloured buckle
Socks: Grey, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, With holes
White, Blue, With dark blue and light blue lines.
Leggings: Cotton, Black, White, Adidas boxers with white lignes.

Case reference: 2012020169.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, the skeletal remains of a man were found in the water at the Reed Point Marina in Port Moody, British Columbia. The man had significant osteoarthritis in his neck and back. He may have been from Alberta and is estimated to have died more than a year prior to discovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, This male was missing a number of teeth and likely wore a partial upper dental plate prior to death.
Socks: Cotton, White, Sport, Blue and red stripes

Case reference: 2014021185.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2005, at approximately 1:00 p.m., Kim-Marie Kinsella was seen for the last time in the area of 1695 Jane Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017056566.CaseDesc: Darryl Gundrum was last seen between March 1 and September 30, 1970, near Sherwood Park, Alberta.

Case reference: 2016061106.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2006, the partial remains of a male were recovered from the Jordan Creek by a local resident who was dismantling a beaver dam on Old Hastings Road, in Centre Hastings, which is located North of Belleville, Ontario. The remains are believed to have been there at least 5 to 10 years and likely many more.

Case reference: 2014000018.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2001, Dawn Rees was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Dawn was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014005807.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2012, Marc St-Laurent was seen for the last time on a bench outside the grocery store at Place Quévillon in Lebel-sur-Quévillon, Quebec. His pick-up, a white 1992 GMC Sierra, was located on 26 July 2012, in a federated snowmobile trail, approximately three kilometres from Lebel-sur-Quévillon.

Case reference: 2006019399.CaseDesc: Randall Gunning was last seen on May 5, 1984, in the area of Elliot Lake. Mr. Gunning suffered from depression and was despondent when he left.
